Questions.Question: Who wrote the novel 'Pride and Prejudice'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Pride and Prejudice' was written by Jane Austen and published in 1813, exploring themes of love and social class.

Questions.Question: Which classic novel features the character Jay Gatsby?
Questions.Explanation: Jay Gatsby is a central character in 'The Great Gatsby' by F. Scott Fitzgerald, published in 1925.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
Questions.Explanation: 'To Kill a Mockingbird' was written by Harper Lee and published in 1960, addressing racial injustice in the American South.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote the novel '1984'?
Questions.Explanation: '1984' was written by George Orwell and published in 1949, depicting a dystopian society under totalitarian rule.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the novel 'Jane Eyre'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Jane Eyre' was written by Charlotte Bronte and published in 1847, exploring themes of love, independence, and morality.

Questions.Question: Which classic novel features the character Elizabeth Bennet?
Questions.Explanation: Elizabeth Bennet is the protagonist in 'Pride and Prejudice' by Jane Austen, published in 1813.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the novel 'Moby-Dick'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Moby-Dick' was written by Herman Melville and published in 1851, exploring themes of obsession and revenge.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote the novel 'The Catcher in the Rye'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Catcher in the Rye' was written by J.D. Salinger and published in 1951, depicting teenage angst and alienation.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the novel 'Wuthering Heights'?
Questions.Explanation: 'Wuthering Heights' was written by Emily Bronte and published in 1847, exploring themes of love and revenge.

Questions.Question: Which classic novel features the character Scout Finch?
Questions.Explanation: Scout Finch is the young protagonist in 'To Kill a Mockingbird' by Harper Lee, published in 1960.

Questions.Question: Who wrote the novel 'The Lord of the Rings'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Lord of the Rings' was written by J.R.R. Tolkien and published between 1954 and 1955, set in a fantasy world.

Questions.Question: Which author wrote the novel 'The Picture of Dorian Gray'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Picture of Dorian Gray' was written by Oscar Wilde and published in 1890, exploring the pursuit of pleasure and beauty.

Questions.Question: Who is the author of the novel 'The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn'?
Questions.Explanation: 'The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn' was written by Mark Twain and published in 1884, addressing racism and morality.

Questions.Question: Which classic novel features the character Holden Caulfield?
Questions.Explanation: Holden Caulfield is the disillusioned protagonist in 'The Catcher in the Rye' by J.D. Salinger, published in 1951.
